title: Get the top-N rows
sql:
select employee_id, salary           EMPLOYEE_ID     SALARY
from   hr.employees                  ----------- ----------
order  by salary                             132       2100
fetch  first 2 rows only;                    128       2200

       

select employee_id, salary           EMPLOYEE_ID     SALARY
from   hr.employees                  ----------- ----------
order  by salary                             132       2100
fetch  first 2 rows with ties;               128       2200
                                             136       2200

explanations.text: Sort by SALARY - low to high - and return at most two rows

Rows two and three have the same value for SALARY
Adding WITH TIES returns both
